website_summaries.verdict: Though on the higher end of the price range, it's a hit among satisfied customers for its reliable quality and impressive level of performance.
pros: Inexpensive maintenance and an ability to produce large amounts of hot water- 60 cups per hour- make it our top pick
Has both hot and cold water levers

customer_reviews.title: much better quality than Insinkerator
customer_reviews.text: Having gone through 2 different Insinkerator tanks, I can honestly say the build quality of both the Ready Hot tank and faucet is ahead of Insinkerator. Comparing the 2 faucets is like comparing a big box store faucet to one from a plumbing supply store. The Ready Hot is heavier and sturdier in the hand, which much fewer plastic parts. An added plus is the rotating spout and the ability to lock the handle in the open position for larger fill jobs. Time will tell if the tank's longevity is better, but the outlook looks good.
customer_reviews.author: dfr

customer_reviews.title: Replaced one under warranty after leakage, 2nd one now leaks also
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first unit 3-1/2 years ago. It has a 3 year warranty and the company was great in sending me a new unit when the first unit started leaking badly after about 2 years. I had to have the plumber come and install it, so it cost me $100 to install the replacement. Now after just over a year, the replacement unit is leaking badly. I decided to take it apart to discover where the leak was coming from rather than get a 3rd unit under warranty. The fitting for the tube at the bottom of the unit is plastic and had broken. See photo. I am going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install. Works Great. A Little Noisy.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very happy with this product. The install was very easy, and the water instantly comes out nice and hot. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because when the water is being heated in the tank (it does this periodically over the course of the day to maintain the water temp), it's a little bit noisy. It's installed in the cabinet under the sink, and even when the doors are shut, I can hear the water getting heated. Maybe this is a normal occurrence, but I'd be even happier if it was quieter!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey AC

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Installation went OK after a trip to the hardware store to buy a connection adapter. After 18 months of use, I am still happy with results but want to warn buyers of 3 problems: 1. It can be noisy while it heats water. Some clunking noises every hour or so. 2. Not really instant. Sometimes have to wait 3-4 seconds for hot water 3. Once in a while (every month or so) it will hiss and spurt water when it is not being used.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for EverHot
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a hot & cold dispenser; the brand is not being made anymore. The hole in my granite is only 35 mm and other brands would not fit. This is a good replacement for the EverHot brand. Only thing I would change on this is the slope of the faucet - so close to the edge of the sink I can't leave water bottles, etc. as the curve of my sink bottom makes them tumble over. Otherwise it is a great replacement, this is my third dispenser - I hope it lasts a while.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Fire Hazard!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this hot water dispenser. It looks nice and works BUT....after one week, we are getting an extreme burning electrical smell emanating from the unit. I had to unplug it and return to Amazon for credit. I called customer service and they told me they would call me back....they didn't. Oh well, on to another company's dispenser. BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Edelson

customer_reviews.title: Working Great One Year After Installation
customer_reviews.text: I installed this unit a bout a year ago, and we love it! I also installed one of these:  The water is VERY hot, almost boiling. In fact, I had to turn the temperature control down slightly to stop it from boiling in the tank and spitting hot water into the sink occasionally. Once set, the temperature is great, and it never spit again. Installation was easy, and the needed connectors were all there. I have it connected to our water distiller, so the fact that this unit has a stainless steel tank was important to me. All connections are compatible with distilled water.
customer_reviews.author: H. Person

customer_reviews.title: great instant hot; hard to install
customer_reviews.text: We were replacing a New Mountain instant hot heater and faucet. The plumbing was all in place. I thought from the web descriptions I could install it myself. Was I wrong. Even my handyman who is really the best had trouble. It took a trip to a plumbing supply store where they had to improvise for one connection. In any event, the hot water heater is great. The temperature control makes minute adjustments and the temperature is as hot as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Surrogate grandma

customer_reviews.title: I am well pleased with my experience with the seller
customer_reviews.text: First the faucet is heavy duty. The unit is a little larger than expected. But that's ok! I'm a serious tea drinker, which means that I don't need to keep heating up my tea pot every time I desire tea. Let me also mention how thankful I am to the seller who positively responded to my shipping request. The item arrived as requested for the contractor to cut the measurement adequately in my new granite countertop for my hot water dispenser. Over all, I am well pleased with my experience with the seller. Again, thank you for honoring my request. It is greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Shadoew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement on ainsinkerstor brand for better price
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase. Went online intending to replace my Insinkeretor hot water dispenser and stumbled on this brand much cheaper and I preferred the faucet over the Insinkerator because it matches the profile of my faucet. Installed easier than the old dispenser. We have no issues with bad tasting water like others have mentioned. Just need to run a few tanks of water through maybe to get the new taste out but wasn’t really an issue for us. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: A. M. C. pesa

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - DIED AFTER 6 MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: Junk, died after 6 months of moderate residential use, usually a cup of hot tea in the evenings or to warm a coffee mug. Prior unit (different manufacturer) lasted 7.5 years. Amazon was great and made a return exception so ultimately a happy ending (except paying plumber twice). Will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Podo98

customer_reviews.title: Faucet failed after a few months
customer_reviews.text: It's a little hard to review this product since it failed so quickly. We purchased it in early November, had the kitchen remodeled for thanksgiving, and then it failed in late December. The failure was primarily the faucet (no water would flow through the faucet, however it would flow through the refrigerator dispenser on the same line). The temperature control was strange. it would be fine, and then randomly start to boil over out of the faucet. We would turn the temperature setting down a fraction and the boiling would stop, but the temperature drop was significant....very fussy. The boiling may be related to our elevation (about 5500 ft) but the fussy control should not be related.
customer_reviews.author: mr4e

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS NOW!  Don't spend time on the Insinkerator  -- this is much better
customer_reviews.text: I've had two insinkerator's, and they both leak. Also, I used the cold/hot insinkerator dispenser. That somehow got clogged and the water comes out super slow. The hot water heater started leaking and caused damage below the sink. This think is WAY better. The dispenser is a better design and have a solid, smooth feel to the knobs. Installation was much easier than the Insinkerator too. Best of all, the price was SOOO much cheaper. It might even be made in the USA -i'm not sure on that. At any rate, I'm really happy with this and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Electronic Guy

customer_reviews.title: We agree with a previous customer who reported a bad taste to the water
customer_reviews.text: We agree with a previous customer who reported a bad taste to the water. It is undrinkable! We are already outside of the "return" period with amazon so we are stuck with this purchase. The manual is poorly written. It shows a water purifier in one of the diagrams in the manual. But they don't mention a water purifier in any of the text, and they don't provide one, although they definitely should. We spent a bunch of money to have a plumber and electrician install this product. Now we are regretting all of this
customer_reviews.author: Newporter

customer_reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise!  Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, my third Franke Water Butler system had a tank failure after 7 years. I can find one for $200. Okay. They tell me the new tank is not compatible with their old faucet, and I need to buy their new model for $500. Well I found this Ready Hot system on Amazon for $200 complete. I thought I'd take a chance, not expecting that much. Product arrived in 24 hours and it is fantastic. Heavy duty, beautiful design and finish. Very smooth operation. Very easy install. I couldn't be more pleased. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: John D. McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Misleading Info
customer_reviews.text: I believed this was an “on demand” water heater that is energy efficient but it is not. Their info is misleading. The “instant” hot water means that it runs constantly wasting electricity. We had to buy new fittings and lines because what came with it is cheap and broke while installing it. Only time will tell if we keep it or not.
customer_reviews.author: DCJax

customer_reviews.title: Love these instant hot water tank.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good after few weeks of use. Installation was simple. I don't hang it on the cabinet wall, just let it sit on its 4 rubber feet in the sink cabinet. Works well with Ready Hot RH-F560-CH Dual Lever Faucet for Hot and Cold Water. I plumbed the outlet from the Reverse osmosis water tank to the faucet, and from the faucet to the hot water tank. I have always use the instant hot water tank in the house for convenient, and have replaced couple tanks from different manufactures over a period of 20 years, and the only reason for replacement is leaking tank. Hoping this tank would give at least 7 or 8 years of use.
customer_reviews.author: N. Dao

customer_reviews.title: Most used tool in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking at this product to see what water filter they recommend to use when I saw that I never wrote a review. As this is one of my favorite tools in my kitchen I thought I should add a review on it. I bought this hot/ cold water dispenser in 2018, and I still love it. I use it daily for tea, washing pots and pans, starting a pot to boil water for cooking and I am never disappointed Highly recommend this product. Still wondering which water filter is best ..guess I will stick with the one I’ve been using.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Failed in 6 mos--leaked, then didn't heat over 140 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Purchased unit in July 2019. Failed heat above 140 degrees in October and started leaking at highest setting in December. I am attempting to get a replacement under the Assurion plan I purchased, but they claim I don't have coverage even though I am looking at the receipt and paperwork. still fighting this.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Contemporary Look and Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: We love the look and ease of use! Because our main faucet is soft water, we wanted to use a hot/cold faucet for filtered water. It is of good quality and works smoothly. The only reason I didn't give the Ready Hot 5 stars is that the temperature on hot is not quite hot enough. If we were to boost the temp upward, the tank under the sink would boIl alot. We would buy it again, but prefer to advise others that a cup of hot tea might require 30 more seconds in the microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Dispenser looks great
customer_reviews.text: The dispenser works well with the hot water side that needs to be depressed before turning for safety. However, the hot water comes out with about a 3 second delay which will take getting use to. The hot water discharge rate seem faster initially then slows down if you need more cups to fill. The cold water side comes out instantly. I have the tap go through a filtration prior to dispensing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: This could have been way better
customer_reviews.text: The package I received did not come with Installation instructions or the proper attachments. I had to go to several stores to find parts that would fit, and when I finally found parts that fit it water filling the bag inside sprayed everywhere. I’m pretty good at making things work, and this flag was not going to fly for me. I rarely return things, however this unit had to go back.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Frost

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a gift for my parents and they love it. They love the ease of instant hot water. Install was pretty straight forward. Did have to run to the hardware store for couple fittings. There is a slight delay of water coming out of faucet when you turn it on but does not bug us. Be really careful when using hot water. My mom accidentally burned her hand with the water and it ended up to be a second degree burn.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, Easy to install with same hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I use it under the sink hot water dispenser. When I bought the house 2005 it has the Kitchen aid which last me about 10 years, the second one i bought a cheap one Hot and Quick lasted about 4 years. So this one Ready Hot I installed about 2 years ago and still working. This ready hot is bigger/heavier than ready hot, doesn't boil down steam on faucet, set temperature about 180 deg F using laser thermometer. I found out the best setting is 175-180, my greeen tea taste better. My brother have the same tank on his 8 years now set at 180, dial pointing right about 16 minute hand.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador

customer_reviews.title: Short lived
customer_reviews.text: After three months air got in the line and the faucet would sporadically spit hot water on my hand when trying to get water into a cup. After five months it started to spit hot water without anyone touching the faucet. We have since turned the heater off and it’s no longer used. I would not recommend shelling out $150 for five months of instant hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit for 2 months. Even though the faucet does put out hot water, it dribbles out with no Pressure. It worked great for a few weeks then all of a sudden it only dribbled out hot water. Cleaned and emptied the canister as per troubleshooting instructions to no avail. No kinks in hoses so something is not right. Will try calling customer service again then removing it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Hines

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install & Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now. It works great, I drink tea and its so nice to draw a cup of hot water right from the tap for my tea. I hesitated to purchase a unit like this because of the price and to have a tap that provides both hot and cold water was way overpriced. I came across this unit and tap and the price was awesome. The reviews were good, except one which the install was totally botched, so I purchased and haven't regretted. The install took about 45 minutes including running a line from my reverse osmosis unit. I will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Peg Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: We like this new hot water dispenser very much. Unit was easy to install, and while large and a bit bulky, fit under the sink fine. One feature we really appreciate is the short delay when turning it on...this prevents the frequent dripping of hot water from the spout, which our prior machine did. We hope this time delay in bringing water to the spout will prevent it from a short life span. We’ll know more how this performs over time.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Defective!
customer_reviews.text: This product was defective but we could only find that out after paying a professional plumber to install it. Tried trouble shooting with the manufacturer, after repeated calls, to no avail. Had to pay the plumber to come back and uninstall it. Bought a different brand, paid plumber to install again, and it works like a charm. I don’t recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: AHoeft

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful operation and instant hot water!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very user friendly hot water dispenser. The installation was very straight forward and took only a matter of about an hour to complete. I did have the hole in the sink already available, so there was no time spent on that aspect. The temperature control is a dial that’s easy to adjust. Another thing I like is that the flow of water is really good and it doesn’t take long to fill a container or glass with water. The movement of the handles and faucet is super smooth. Overall, I’m very pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Great product, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install. I am pretty handy and installed this on my own. I had a little trouble with the base install. The easy install bracket wouldn’t thread for me at first. Took a little persuasion. Also needed a hardware store run. All the parts needed are not provided because the connection to water will be different for everyone. Would recommend this product. Looks good. Quiet. Really wanted the combo of cold and hot water. Contacted the manufacturer about one part of the install and they were very responsive and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: So much better than ISO!
customer_reviews.text: Have had 3 ISO over the last 20 years. Put up with the spitting, leaking, etc. Decided to try a different brand and WOW! This unit is beautiful, sturdy, quiet, and all-around better! The water is hotter and the flow is stronger. Since I was replacing hot water unit, the only additional parts needed were a 1/4 inch sleeve and nut. No foul taste from the silicone tubing, either. So so happy with this choice!
customer_reviews.author: D J Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Last one (different model, different brand, same manufacturer, likely same mechanism inside) starting smelling like burnt rubber after 3 years and had to go. Replace yesterday, easy enough (although this larger case has input in different spot and had to be hanged differently), but works well. Digital temperature is useful, but measures temp somewhere in tank and not at faucet. It's much better to have it instead of analog dial where the temp itself is unknown. We'll see if we get more than 3 years out of it. Warranty is for 1 year. The tea I made tasted fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. L. LeGassy

customer_reviews.title: Well built, solid handle, convenient
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace our electric tea kettle to free up counter space. Unit is built well and faucet is solid and easy to use. Had to go to HD to get a compression valve/link which is stated in the instructions. Once installed, it works perfect. I used a coconut inline filter which made the hot water taste good. The unit does cycle on every so often to keep the water at the chosen temperature which makes a little sound. Great to have hot water ok demand.
customer_reviews.author: K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Thermal Control Is Marginal but the install was easy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Installation of the faucet was really slick and easy. Cons: Thermal control is marginally acceptable. You can get to 190F as advertised. However you have to put the thermastat at 100%. If you leave it at 100% the unit boils over and shoots steam out the faucet occasionally. Later when you try to use it again you have to use cold water to push out the hot, reducing the effective temperature. In practice you cannot leave the thermostat at the temperature needed for 190F water if you want 190F water the next day.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Water tastes like chemicals
customer_reviews.text: The water tastes terrible. I have never had a problem with our water tasting bad but something inside the tank is causing it to taste like chemicals. I have flushed it out completely at least a dozen times and it helps temporarily but the bad taste comes back after time, especially if the water has been sitting in the tank for a couple of days. I was hoping it would improve over time, especially since I had to pay a plumber to install it. Unfortunately, it has not gotten any better and the return cut off was 3 days ago. I am worried the water could be bad for my family’s health.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Item was opened not sure if the tank was used or not
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st time I have received an item that was used/opened. The item had the shipping label removed and missing the plastic caps on the tank. Will install it to see if it works since it seems like a sturdy item. I might call amazon to see if it is returnable after it try and install it and it doesn't work. Will post the results later.
customer_reviews.author: pm711

customer_reviews.title: Short life span, works great until it doesn’t!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I have to replace them every 1-2 years, but man, what great hot water when it’s working! Leaks when it fails as if it were the tears of our unborn instant cup of tea or hot chocolate!
customer_reviews.author: Jack C

customer_reviews.title: Love Love Love!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 2 weeks now. Works as advertised! Instant near boiling water, perfect for tea or getting a head start for boiling pasta or rice. Initially the water had a metallic taste but after flushing the tank several times over a couple days, no more bad taste. Time will tell how it holds up. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Short term junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit March 5, 2020 and it is already a problem unit. The water is hot coming out, but the unit makes so much noise when not being used. It sounds like the unit is purging air or water from the line. Next time you need hot water, the unit seems to be less than full of hot water because it takes more time to provide hot water.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Creel

customer_reviews.title: Love the tall spout and nice flow
customer_reviews.text: We have had several instead hot taps over the years, this one seems like it’s gonna be a favorite. I really like the taller spout. The flow of the water is much faster than any instant hot we’ve had before. So far, we love it. Dispenses almost boiling water regularly. We use it all the time for hot tea, instant hot cocoa, making mac & cheese etc.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous ohio

customer_reviews.title: Great contemporary design
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this water heater and tap for about two months and I love it. The tap is a thoughtful design with a safety button that prevents accidental spout pours. I highly recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: CAT Lady

customer_reviews.title: it was easy to install and has met our expectations
customer_reviews.text: Straight and to the point, it was easy to install and has met our expectations. I would only caution that the temps can exceed the temps noted for the product and always advise members of the household and guests that the faucet this unit serves produces very hot water. I would also recommend after install and periodically thereafter that you use an appropriate thermometer to check the temperature of the water at the faucet discharge point to validate and adjust settings as deemed necessary for your needs and safety.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not my first, but the best by far
customer_reviews.text: I have installed and worn out 4 similar systems before this one. The installation on this one was the best so far. They have incorporated many handy helpers that made it super easy. They use standard John-Guest style plumbing quick disconnects and standard tube sizes and it was easy to connect this to a filter and the existing plumbing. Faucet works better than any of the others I have had. Unit is set at about 90% and is slightly too hot for coffee or tea. I just mix in a little cool water as I am dispensing and have the super hot water when I want it for other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy D. Jerome

customer_reviews.title: Product too large for our space.
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product because of the price and the faucet style that matched our sink and faucet. I did not pay enough attention to the size of the water heater box. This is quite large when compared to some other brands. As it turns out, we had to return the product because it would not fit in our space. Measure before you buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alan B. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the product.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Good product overall, with great value. The faucet has a nice, modern look to it. There is a slight delay (1-2 seconds) when you turn on the hot water, but honestly I would still buy this again. Compared to others we’ve seen and the cost of those, this is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: L.D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for teas and Instant ramen!
customer_reviews.text: Install was very simple. you must have a 1 3/8" hole which is a standard for most sinks. I was worried about smell after reading another review here , but there is no odd smell what so ever with the hot water. so far We love it! no more hotpots on counter.
customer_reviews.author: amathomas

customer_reviews.title: Installation instruction is inadequate.
customer_reviews.text: Instructions for tube connections dont match the Lables on the faucet and heater. Hoses need to be cut to proper length and affixed to the faucet prior to mounting it to the counter. That detail saves much time and is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Orbit

customer_reviews.title: Instant boiling hot water
customer_reviews.text: Really simple installation. If you follow what they say, it is a pretty straight forward installation. I decided to just make it sit on the floor and that is fine. I just got a "T" fitting that was half inch in half inch out with a quarter inch outlet on the side. Also needed to buy a quarter inch compression fitting to connect the water supply to the faucet that came with it. To hours that included removing the garbage disposal and putting it back on.
customer_reviews.author: Akshay Sharma

customer_reviews.title: Convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Instant hot water is wonderfully convenient. We just set it at max temperature. Hotter the better. These units do not last forever. We have had units that leaked in 2 years. Others lasted nearly 10 years. All on RO Water system.
customer_reviews.author: Ray T.

customer_reviews.title: Poor product quality and sad customer service
customer_reviews.text: Fly clear of this product! I am very handy and the installation parts are poorly made. Had issue with initial install and needed to use hack saw to remove stripped screws. Their customer service stinks. Save your money and buy from another company. You will save yourself a lot of aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: JlEF

customer_reviews.title: Easy install & works great!
customer_reviews.text: One doesn't need a plumber - thi sis an easy install if you just read the directions. I added a water filter AND changes our regular faucet at the same time - all by myself! I've had this in for a week or so and absolutely love it! I spent alot of time to find a pfister faucet that matched, and together these looks great! Making coffee or tea has never been easier.. and we run our cutting boards under to help sanitize them. Everyone in the house loves it.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: its.... well ok
customer_reviews.text: It heats water....got what we paid for. It is much louder than our last one. Also be very careful when you hook it up. Ours had the bottom connection loose and it leaked water when we hooked it up. I would have sent it back if i had not already installed the fittings and had it hung in place. So loud, leaky but heats water.... you be the judge.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for money, looks great
customer_reviews.text: Ordered one for our condo remodel (for sale). End result high-end, stylish, and this hot water faucet finished the look for kitchen. Buyers liked what they saw, and from what we can tell it works well, although can not vouch for longevity. Very likely to actually order one for our own new home as well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Saloranta

customer_reviews.title: Don't know if it's any good because parts are missing.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 60 days ago to install in a renovation that got delayed. Plumber went to install today and parts are missing. Obviously well past return date so I'm out $209. Plumber said the missing parts are not available from any plumbing supply house.
customer_reviews.author: M. Novick

customer_reviews.title: Instant Hot Water install
customer_reviews.text: Got the hot water dispenser, very easy to install. I will update later as this is the 1st day after installed. I did have water filters already installed. The previous instant hit water heater lasted 10 years. Hopefully this one lasts as long or longer since it’s stainless steel.
customer_reviews.author: WW

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised for 2.5 years in ROS
customer_reviews.text: Moderate price, easy installation, and works as advertised. When installed in an ROS system it lasted 2.5 years before tank leaks occurred. A stainless steel tank might be better in an ROS system.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Its great and came with a new faucet that matched my sink great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hoses were too short.
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice treat to have it, but hoses were too short with the product. They should make it doable for a standard sink cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Received on time. Instructions were simple and clear. Was able install myself, without a handyman, and it is working just like my previous one - Little Little Chef Instant Water Heater. Very happy with the Digital display of temperature, a feature of product.
customer_reviews.author: KChinnappan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Family members dubious at first, but surprised at how handy it is. Put a 3rd party filter in front of it. It's a lot cheaper than the other brand, and comes with a great looking hot/cold dual faucet. It's got a safety mechanism, but after you push it down, then the hot water will stay on hands free. This is great! Update: After 2 years, we still love it. Update: After 2.5 years, it stopped heating. It has a 3 year warranty, which Ready Hot honored painlessly by sending a new tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good after using this instant hot water dispenser for a ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good after using this instant hot water dispenser for a month. Had it professionally installed, so I can't speak to ease of installation, but complaints I saw about the 1 second delay to produce water and the fact that the heater infrequently make a small amount of noise though true, are hardly inconvenient. I recommend this unit to anyone interested. It looks good, functions well and was reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Kaestner

customer_reviews.title: Nice hot and cold water dispenser
customer_reviews.text: This hot and cold water dispenser suits our needs. The water connection lines were too short to be connected where the tank needed to fit so we had to get a plumber to make the additional connections for the device to fit where it needed to be. I wish they would have recommended the addition of a water filter so I could have bought that at the same time I bought the dispenser. It works well and much less expensive than competing devices.
customer_reviews.author: larry e.

customer_reviews.title: Instant hot water
customer_reviews.text: My husband was able to install it himself. He struggled a little bit, was able to figure it out. It has a nicer faucet/handles than ones we have had in the past. You can set the temperature somewhat.
customer_reviews.author: doodlebug

customer_reviews.title: Hot tea in a snap!
customer_reviews.text: Filtered hot water in a snap. I already had the filter installed. This was hot water thingy was added. Love it! Never knew how many uses I get out of it. Even simplest of things.
customer_reviews.author: Karla

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Works great had to replace an everpure unit this did the job nicely, well thought through install, made it easy to put in, did myself in under an hour
customer_reviews.author: Homeschooling Mama

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but wrong faucet sent.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the unit with both hot and cold water handles, but item shipped only has hot water handle. Will try to get replacement and hopefully correct faucet arrives. Otherwise, the faucet itself seems very high quality. The water unit itself seems very well made with all metal construction.
customer_reviews.author: C. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I have had this installed for a few days and I am using it frequently and loving it. I hired someone to install it and they did not seem to have any difficulities. I love wvwrything about it, the delay, the adjustment, the cold option, the swivel.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Shryock

customer_reviews.title: Works great and simple to hook up
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to hook up. As others point out, the faucet head doesn't extend very far, so if you're placing counters before buying this, have the put the faucet cutout as close to the sink as possible. I just installed this in a bar sink with an inline filter and it's working like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Great Hot and Cold Water Dispenser
customer_reviews.text: Since my wife likes hot water and my son and I like cool water, this unit is great. Very well made and hopefully will last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: mr.chinatown

customer_reviews.title: working great.
customer_reviews.text: Working perfectly. Replace my last one with this and it hooked up and running quickly. I like that it has feet to stand on, and doesn't have to be hung.
customer_reviews.author: Hijo Del Sol

customer_reviews.title: Great hot and cold water dispenser!
customer_reviews.text: I love my hot water dispenser, which also has a cold water dispenser included. I had to purchase an under-sink filter in order to use this.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Paauw

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Use it every day. Coffee, tea, preheat thermos for soup. Love the dispenser. I do wish it had a separate feed for hot and cold.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Not being a plumber, I was concerned that I would have to spend more on installation than the cost of the unit. Installed in 15 minutes since I was able to use my existing faucet. Wifey burned herself and turned down the temperature. Definitely would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Art M.

customer_reviews.title: Better than some say but not great...hope it lasts.
customer_reviews.text: Better than some reviews indicated but you have to go to your local hardware store to get some of the plumbing fittings. Also there is a good 4 second delay when you want to get the hot water and it gushes out initially so be careful. That design flaw needs to be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Energy of 2

customer_reviews.title: They dont honor their warranty
customer_reviews.text: I brought this product a year ago and the faucet started leaking few week ago. I called their customer service number and they responded with saying that the faucet was out of warranty. The product details on the page says it has a 3 year warranty however apparently only that tank has a 3 year warranty but the faucet only has a 1 year warranty. Deceptive marketing!!
customer_reviews.author: gratet

customer_reviews.title: Take your time.
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. Instructions were very good. I do wish they would have label actually on the tank for in and out supply. They only tell you in the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful and works as good as it looks. Highly recommended. I wish they made the neck of the spout angle more over the sink to make filling a pot easier and not be so close to the edge of the sink.
customer_reviews.author: QTPA2T

customer_reviews.title: Product performs as expected
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived promptly. Based on prior reviews, I verified all parts were enclosed, The Ready Hot was installed professionally without any issues; and it worked perfectly. We are satisfied with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Friend

customer_reviews.title: Need to return! No help from Manufacture!
customer_reviews.text: Need to return this Hot Water Dispenser!!! Have tried numerous times to receive help from the manufacturer regarding the spout to connect. Ones we have purchased will not fit nor work! Have called company; voice mail full, have tried to email; no response. NO HELP! Please share with me how to return so I may begin this process again!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2.5 years.
customer_reviews.text: The water intake connection on the bottom of the tank bag an leaking after 2.5 years. It is plastic and had eroded, so I couldn’t even fix a gasket or repair the connection. Had to scrap the whole tank and order a new one....
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mohr

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Water is extremely hot
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Water is extremely hot, and I like that in order to use the faucet on the hot water side you have to press down on the handle first. I install this myself which was pretty straight forward....I also have it hooked up to my APEC Reverse Osmosis system.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Superior product at a very reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Far superior product to the insinkerator product I have used in the past. Best feature is ability to leave the faucet running when you are filling a pot or pitcher without having to stand there and hold the lever down. The price is much more reasonable than the competing products. I have never had an insinkerator that lasted more than 4 years. This is a much better product at half the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry S

customer_reviews.title: very fine product.
customer_reviews.text: The hot water dispenser was installed and we are very satisfied with the product which appears well manufactured and works excellent. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos A. Serna

customer_reviews.title: Simplify life!
customer_reviews.text: The challenge was finding the brushed brass faucet! The rest was a walk in the park!
customer_reviews.author: Robert T

customer_reviews.title: A top kitchen appliance to have!
customer_reviews.text: We use it for that late night cup of hot tea (for the last 20 years!)
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: We have been through other brands. This seems like it it last better. It was easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Franke instant hot that was about 20 years old. The faucet is heavy and of very good quality. The installation was easy. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: lrm

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: This unit does not measure up to the Insinkerator that I had. On the hottest setting the temperature isn’t what was advertised. It also periodically spits out water from the tap. Now that I paid someone to install I guess it’s staying. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: lane Yager

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: Start-up’s automatic set point wrong. Should start at lowest setting, not highest setting-
customer_reviews.author: Scott Lombardo

customer_reviews.title: Faulty advertising!! Be aware!!!
customer_reviews.text: All the pictures of this shows it with a single hot water handle yet when I get it in the mail it has a hot and cold valve. What? I already have a hot and cold kitchen faucet 6” away. Not I have to figure out how to get the same product with the same corresponding faucet that matches the picture (why I bought it in the first place). Annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: House To Home Builders

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: It is a good product after it is installed. We are enjoying it. The hose provided is a little short at least for our kitchen. Had to be creative to extend the waterline.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ma

customer_reviews.title: works but noisy
customer_reviews.text: it works. easy to install. but makes whoosh noise when boils and it re-boils almost every time you fill a cup of hot water. and sometimes re-boils even in middle of nite. I can hear it from my bedroom which is 20 feet away. however, the noise only lasts about 5 seconds. if you don't mind the noise then it's good.
customer_reviews.author: ynot

customer_reviews.title: I like hot water for instant coffee and to preheat water ...
customer_reviews.text: It makes water hot. I like hot water for instant coffee and to preheat water I am going to boil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great HOT water machine.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you have the correct connector. One connector not included.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great heater. Much better made than the onenit replaced and a way better price. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working very good.
customer_reviews.text: Ease to install. Working very good. Very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far. Seems high quality but the test will come over time.
customer_reviews.text: Appears to be a higher quality product than my previous installation of a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bud V

customer_reviews.title: Unit Failed
customer_reviews.text: Apparently not Stainless Steel Internals ? Tank failed after 4 months by producing brown water even though the fresh water supplied was perfectly clear Osmosis Water.
customer_reviews.author: crystal t wright

customer_reviews.title: Mine failed on first install in two separate locations.
customer_reviews.text: First install failed 3 times in a row. First time the rubber hose from filter to tank failed/exploded. Second time took it all the way apart to replace hose and check on gasket in tank which is constantly failing now. I’m past the return phase for Amazon as well as I ordered in January for a house remodel and just trying to install it now on April 18, 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Kort Frank

product_meta.title: Ready Hot RH-200-F560-CH Instant Dispenser, 9 x 8 x 11.5 inches, Includes Chrome Hot and Cold Water Faucet
product_meta.description:
Color:Includes Chrome Hot and Cold Water Faucet| Style:Manual DialFor years, The only solutions to hot water were stove-top or microwave heating. Now, the Ready Hot Instant hot water tank can deliver 200 degree water at your fingertips with no waste, Use only what you need. The near-boiling water makes beverage and instant foods in seconds including tea, coffee, cocoa, soups, noodles, pasta, and vegetables. In addition, it may be used for many other household tasks like warming baby food & bottles or cleaning pots & pans.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
For years, the only solutions to hot water were stove-top or microwave heating. Now, the Ready Hot instant hot water tank can deliver 190 degree water at your fingertips with no waste, use only what you need. The near-boiling water makes beverage and instant foods in seconds including tea, coffee, cocoa, soups, noodles, pasta, and vegetables. In addition, it may be used for many other household tasks like warming baby food & bottles or cleaning pots & pans.
feature_bullets: READY HOT INSTANT HOT WATER DISPENSER: The Ready Hot instant hot water dispenser can dispense 60+ cups of near boiling water per hour with adjustable temperature from 140 to 200 degrees

YOUR CHOICE OF FAUCET: The Ready Hot water dispenser comes with an open vented single lever hot water faucet or dual lever hot/cold faucet in your choice of Brushed Nickel or Chrome. You can also buy the tank separately, but it does require an open vented faucet to operate

QUALITY COMPONENTS: The 2. 5 quart stainless steel under sink hot water tank comes with a 110-volt 1300-watt stainless steel heating element and stainless-steel inlet and outlet tubes.Only use mild cleaners to clean the faucet and plastic components

HOT WATER ON DEMAND: Ideal for home, office, restaurants, cafeterias, or wherever instant hot water is needed. Make instant hot tea, coffee, soup, oatmeal or cook noodles al dente. Also great for loosening stubborn jar lids and warming baby bottles.
AUTOMATED TANK PROTECTION: The automated water heater includes a self-resetting thermal fuse that prevents tank burnout in case of accidental dry startup
ENERGY EFFICENT: Uses less electricity than a 40-watt lightbulb and comes with a pre-installed power cord
INSTALLATION: Easy to install quick connectors make it less likely to have any kinked lines during installation. 1 3/8 inch diameter hole is required for the faucet to be mounted.

specifications.Color: Includes Chrome Hot and Cold Water Faucet
specifications.Included Components: Chrome Dual Lever Hot and Cold Faucet, Hot Water Tank
specifications.Warranty Description: 3-YEAR MANUFACTURER WARRANTY: The manufacturer offers a 3-year warranty on this Ready Hot water dispenser. A defective or inoperative dispenser and/or faucet will be replaced by the company at no charge to the consumer/purchaser. Service or labor charges are not included. Original sales receipt required.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars400 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
